justification: The article states that anxiety was assessed with “the seven-item Generalized Anxiety Disorder [GAD-7] scale” as a standard symptom instrument.
It notes depression was measured using “the seven-item depression subscale [7-down] of the 7-up/7-down scale”.
Hypomania was captured with “the seven-item hypomania subscale [7-up] of the 7-up/7-down scale”.
Anhedonia was assessed via “the 14-item Snaith-Hamilton Pleasure Scale [SHAPS].”
Experiment 2 added “the 20-item short version of the Affect Intensity Measure” for exploratory analyses.
Participants also completed “the depression subscale of the Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale.”
The protocol included “the 5-item Altman Self-Rating Mania Scale.”
During the task, participants reported current affect “using a slider response scale” referred to as the Affective Slider.

measured_by: Risky decision-making task with embedded affect probes
justification: Individual differences in affective reactivity were quantified “using a variant of a recently developed behavioral task… with embedded high-frequency sampling of subjective affect.”
